businessProfile.name: Panhandler's Pizza - Fort Collins, CO
businessProfile.address: 2721 S College Ave, Fort Collins, CO 80521, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 2721 S College Ave, Fort Collins, CO 80521, USA

reviews.text: I have been a loyal patron of Panhandlers since the 1990‚Äôs. The last three times we have ordered pizza - the same pizza we always order it has been wrong. Twice there was sausage instead of pepperoni so we waited half an hour for the correct pizza to be made and went back to the store and picked it up.  Tonight - 3rd time!!! Pick up the pizza and the Chicago style sauce is not on the pizza. Chicago style sauce costs extra. From the manager on duty we got take the pizza or wait 25 minutes for another pizza to be made. It‚Äôs 8 pm, we already waited 45 minutes before we could pick up our pizza. I‚Äôm not going to sit there for another half hour for another pizza to be made. I don‚Äôt eat plain pepperoni pizza so we came home with a pizza we paid extra for (the sauce) and no offer of refund- even for the sauce that is missing!  Ridiculous - don‚Äôt know that we‚Äôll go back. What‚Äôs the point to be loyal when you‚Äôre treated like it‚Äôs not their problem when the order is wrong?!  We had patience the first two times - now my patience is gone.

The service was 10/10. Really liked the table inside the cilo, too. But the restaurant has a misunderstanding about Chicago-style pizza...... It's supposed to be thick with cheese and sausage, not half cooked dough üòí üòï.  Also, they charge 53 cents for a small container of ranch, and it's only half full. 70 dollars for a below average pizza, a salad, and cheese bread.  There are many better options for pizza close by unless you can't eat without the folks singing there.
Here tonight for a Rocky Mtn HS reunion party - pizza with a band! Staff is CRUSHING IT! Great food, great atmosphere, great music! üíï

$45 for a large four topping pizza?! I was blown away during my recent visit that a pizza could be so expensive. We‚Äôve been coming to Panhandler‚Äôs‚Äòs pizza in northern Colorado and more specifically Fort Collins Colorado for more than 30 years. The original location at campus west was a unique blend of quality pizza, great service, and a fantastic atmosphere. the pizza is still fantastic and probably the best pizza in all of Fort Collins if you‚Äôre looking for the classic deep dish. However, during my most recent visit to the newer location in mid town, Fort Collins, not only was I shocked at the price of the pizza, I was shocked at the number of dirty tables with dishes piled up on them throughout the entire restaurant. I would say about 90% of the tables were dirty and had not been cleaned. There was one person working behind the counter, taking orders, and responsible for keeping the front of the house clean. I understand that food cost is high right now but $45 for a pizza is way too much. I‚Äôd like to say that we will continue to go here for Pizza but given the previous experience I‚Äôm not so sure that we will. I give a five star rating for the awesome pizza.

Panhandlers was so delicious!! Its thick crust and generous amounts of toppings left me wanting to try every flavor! We got the Dsayuno breakfast pizza, the beggar with Chicago style sauce, and a large cheese. The breakfast pizza includes green chili, sausage, bell peppers, onions, eggs, and gooey amazing cheese! It was our overall favorite pizza. They were all incredibly delicious!! It is a little pricey, but most definitely worth it!!!!

editorial_summary.overview: Casual spot for pan pizza with whole wheat & gluten-free crust options, plus creative toppings.

recentReviews.text: This is the best pizza restaurant in Fort Collins.   The staff has always been very kind and courteous. Whether it is take out or dine- in,  I would highly suggest this pizza parlor.
Came in for a pick up order, and I seen this peach pizza that sounded amazing! I asked the lady about it and she insisted I tried it. Oh boy was she right such an amazing piece of pie!!
Here tonight for a Rocky Mtn HS reunion party - pizza with a band! Staff is CRUSHING IT! Great food, great atmosphere, great music! üíï

Gross would‚Äôve rather had papa John‚Äôs
My dudes. Their breakfast pizzas. Nuff said.
The food is good but not with the price, $30 for a personal pizza!? That‚Äôs Insane.

detailedReviews.text: Gross would‚Äôve rather had papa John‚Äôs

detailedReviews.author: Becca Taylor
detailedReviews.text: My dudes. Their breakfast pizzas. Nuff said.

detailedReviews.author: David Blue
detailedReviews.text: The food is good but not with the price, $30 for a personal pizza!? That‚Äôs Insane.

detailedReviews.author: Robert Woodson
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza around! Been going here for 50 years and it's always stellar.

detailedReviews.author: Theresa Kamphaus
detailedReviews.text: Quick and easy dinner with slices of pizza,  yumm!

detailedReviews.author: lyn brown
detailedReviews.text:
Pizza is absolutely amazing, Love this place !!!!
Best pizza in Fort Collins by a mile !

detailedReviews.author: Theo
detailedReviews.text:
I don't give out many reviews, but this has been on my mind a lot lately.
I called ahead and put in an order for 2 medium size pizzas.   The person on the phone said 35 to 40 mins to pick up.
I walked in 45 mins later and my pizza still wasn't ready.  Took another 10 mins before I received my order.   Here is the kicker.
I always  leave a 20% tip,  cause I know restaurant workers work hard.
Without my tip, 2 medium pizzas costed me $56 give or take some change.

Pizza was not bad, but it wasn't the greatest,  nor worth the price.

detailedReviews.author: Sandra Law
detailedReviews.text:
Pan's is the best! There is nothing like their Chicago style pizza here in Fort Collins or in all of Colorado, for that matter. üòçüòç

Edit: still super amazing pizza, atmosphere and staff! :D

Edit: the pizza seems to be getting better!

detailedReviews.author: Dave Chen
detailedReviews.text: The service was 10/10. Really liked the table inside the cilo, too. But the restaurant has a misunderstanding about Chicago-style pizza...... It's supposed to be thick with cheese and sausage, not half cooked dough üòí üòï.  Also, they charge 53 cents for a small container of ranch, and it's only half full. 70 dollars for a below average pizza, a salad, and cheese bread.  There are many better options for pizza close by unless you can't eat without the folks singing there.

detailedReviews.author: Kenneth Marks
detailedReviews.text: Fantastic place

detailedReviews.author: George Burns3
detailedReviews.text: Panhandlers pizza is the bomb, the best around great friendly service and the pizza is great I have been eating panhandlers pizza for over 30 years and still love it

detailedReviews.author: Chad
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza ever!

detailedReviews.author: Rebecca Cowley
detailedReviews.text: Sliced were cold and the sauce was more peppery than the usual sweet sauce

detailedReviews.author: Julie Browne
detailedReviews.text:
Panhandlers is amazing.  The iconic sauce has not changed in 40 years.  So many
Memories of picking up a slice for
Dinner in college.  ü•≥üôåüèª

detailedReviews.author: G K
detailedReviews.text: I love the pizza here. The sauce has a nice sweetness to it and the crust is usually a good mix of crunchy and soft. Love that you can just pick up slices. Great! Now I want some.

detailedReviews.author: Bill Tucker
detailedReviews.text:
Can be a little loud on Friday nights but it‚Äôs a bright spot in midtown.

Able to deliver to maxline when their food truck is MIA they are the reliable piece of Fort Collins history.

Breakfast pizza on bike to work day? Priceless.

detailedReviews.author: jason giffin
detailedReviews.text: Any pizza here is really good.

detailedReviews.author: Antonio Ledezma
detailedReviews.text: Excellent pizza, reminds of the 90s in the best possible way

detailedReviews.author: Nathan T
detailedReviews.text:
Avoid this place at all costs.

The worst customer service slap in the face. Unbelievable attitude from the girl at the counter telling me to go to Slyce because I did not want a pepperoni slice that is touching the sausage slice.

DO NOT come here. This business was previously making great pizza and had to sell out to a new owner. The quality and the service has obviously done a 180 degree flip.

detailedReviews.author: john montell
detailedReviews.text: Ordered a pizza through grub hub.  Pizza showed up in 30 minutes and was absolutely disgusting. The dough was raw and cold in the center. The cheese was barely melted. Inedible is an understatement. Called to make them aware and got the cold shoulder from the manager. $40 down the drain. Never again.

detailedReviews.author: Raquel Peluci
detailedReviews.text: So good!

detailedReviews.author: Jen Martinez
detailedReviews.text: I have been a loyal patron of Panhandlers since the 1990‚Äôs. The last three times we have ordered pizza - the same pizza we always order it has been wrong. Twice there was sausage instead of pepperoni so we waited half an hour for the correct pizza to be made and went back to the store and picked it up.  Tonight - 3rd time!!! Pick up the pizza and the Chicago style sauce is not on the pizza. Chicago style sauce costs extra. From the manager on duty we got take the pizza or wait 25 minutes for another pizza to be made. It‚Äôs 8 pm, we already waited 45 minutes before we could pick up our pizza. I‚Äôm not going to sit there for another half hour for another pizza to be made. I don‚Äôt eat plain pepperoni pizza so we came home with a pizza we paid extra for (the sauce) and no offer of refund- even for the sauce that is missing!  Ridiculous - don‚Äôt know that we‚Äôll go back. What‚Äôs the point to be loyal when you‚Äôre treated like it‚Äôs not their problem when the order is wrong?!  We had patience the first two times - now my patience is gone.

detailedReviews.author: Mike Snavely
detailedReviews.text: Counter serve place. Good pizza. The ‚ÄúChicago Style‚Äù is quite tasty but not at all a Chicago style pie.

detailedReviews.author: Alan Vickers
detailedReviews.text: We have eaten at Panhandler‚Äôs in person as well as ordered online for delivery a combined total of at least 8 times in less than a year and have only been fully satisfied once. The issues have been that the pizza order is wrong, missing items, never shows up and/or the people we‚Äôve interacted with in store/on phone have been rude and less than helpful. The pizza is good but we will not be giving them any more of our business and will share that sentiment with anyone who is inquiring about their product, it‚Äôs a shame they can‚Äôt do better.

detailedReviews.author: Zeldas Champion
detailedReviews.text: Very unique taste on their dough they use. Has a more sweet honey flavor to it. Would recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Bryan Thomsen
detailedReviews.text: Great food. Great service.

detailedReviews.author: JOE SHRAY
detailedReviews.text: I dropped by today to enjoy Panhandler's 50th anniversary specials. Since I have been a customer for 50 years this meant a lot to me, contemplating the passage of half a century. The shop was very busy but the pizza was great as always. Thanks to Panhandler's for today's specials and for 50 years of great pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Max Butzbach
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza but lord

detailedReviews.author: Jairo Melgarejo
detailedReviews.text:
Some places are special not just because of the food, but because of the memories, the stories, and the moments they hold. Panhandler‚Äôs Pizza is exactly that kind of place.

For my partner, Lauren, this has been her favorite pizza since childhood‚Äîa place where she shared meals, laughter, and stories with her grandparents, parents, friends, and now our own family. This kind of nostalgia is rare, and finding a restaurant that carries the weight of so many years of love and tradition is something truly priceless.

But let‚Äôs be clear‚Äîit‚Äôs not just nostalgia; the pizza is absolutely delicious. My most recent visit was just this week. I stopped in to pick up a few slices to go for the family and while waiting, I ordered a local beer (because that‚Äôs all they serve, and I love that detail). The staff was friendly, welcoming, and exactly the kind of people you want running a place with this much history. When I got home, we opened up the box, and there it was‚Äîthe same incredible pizza Lauren has loved her whole life, still as amazing as ever.

She asked me, ‚ÄúIs the pizza really that good, or do you think it‚Äôs the nostalgia that makes me love it so much?‚Äù

My answer? It‚Äôs both. A place like this wouldn‚Äôt have lasted since 1975 if the pizza wasn‚Äôt exceptional, and the pizza wouldn‚Äôt taste quite as magical if it didn‚Äôt come with the memories. It‚Äôs the perfect match of flavor and feeling, and that‚Äôs something you can‚Äôt fake.

Places like Panhandler‚Äôs Pizza don‚Äôt just happen every day‚Äîthey are cherished, legendary, and one-of-a-kind. If you‚Äôve never been, you‚Äôre missing out on one of the most special pizza experiences you‚Äôll ever have.

detailedReviews.author: Kaylyn Pierro
detailedReviews.text: If you like thick crust pizza, this is the place for you. Low key atmosphere, and occasional live music.

detailedReviews.author: Hasan Pringle
detailedReviews.text: Left to take food to my car and when I came back my sunglasses was gone. Noone else in the restaurant besides workers. When I asked them the workers didn't want to answer. One was the manager said he eas the owner. Average pizza, dishonest business.

detailedReviews.author: Z Curse
detailedReviews.text:
Hate to leave this review because our family loves this place. The owner when she is there is amazing.

We got there at about 530 pm and were told 20 minutes on our order of slices. No big deal because they come out fresh.

After 40min. We go back up and the staff was arguing about where the slices went. Apparently we now had to wait another 20min. for our slices.

They offered a half off refund at least but we have kids that were starving and waiting over an hour for 4 slices of pizza is not good service. At least offer something for the kids to snack on.

detailedReviews.author: Sara Murdock
detailedReviews.text: Great little hole in the wall type spot! The staff was great. Service was quick despite the place being packed. Gluten free crust available. Sometimes they even have live music! Casual, fun, pretty good pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Myles Chadwick
detailedReviews.text: Great locally owned spot for deep or pan pizza. Vegan cheese and meats available! The staff are great and the owner is often there working the room and helping out. They also have live music frequently so check ahead to see who is playing!

detailedReviews.author: Chris Gonzales
detailedReviews.text: The wife and I stopped by from Greeley for lunch to try something different and we were not disappointed. We ordered the lovehandler pizza and they told us it would take 20 minutes and it was worth the wait. It‚Äôs their version of a supreme and their Italian sausage stole the show! It was delicious and piping hot. The manager/owner I‚Äôm assuming, asked how it was and I told her that I was calling the police because they assaulted my taste buds and we both got a laugh out of it. Great service and atmosphere too!

detailedReviews.author: Jay Cee
detailedReviews.text: Good pizza

detailedReviews.author: ShonTay Culbreth
detailedReviews.text: It was our first time trying it and we won‚Äôt be back. It wasn‚Äôt very busy. Maybe 6 people were there and they already had their food. We still waited well over 30 minutes for our pizza. The pizza had so much sauce and was super doughy which made it extremely hard to eat. Again the amount of sauce on the pizza was insane. We ordered one pizza and three soft drinks for $60. Ridiculous.

detailedReviews.author: James Towne
detailedReviews.text: The slices are always delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Trib Force
detailedReviews.text:
This is my favorite pizza place
in the entire world!

detailedReviews.author: Lars Eriksen
detailedReviews.text: Pans is great, they have ready to order slices and make pies. The pizza is great and the new location is awesome

detailedReviews.author: Nicholis Hilsabeck
detailedReviews.text: The pizza dough was not thouroughly the pizza. When the pizza is cooking you have to pop the bubbles and not leave the bubbles so it's not deformed. Overall I will not be going back to this place.

detailedReviews.author: Sonja Salzburg
detailedReviews.text: We used to go to the old Panhandler's back in the day, and were so sad when they were closing, so we are so happy they are still around! The people who work there are literally always the NICEST when we come in, either for pickup or to eat with our family- the food is delicious, the salads are crisp, and the soda machine is clean. This is our go-to pizza place in town.

detailedReviews.author: Jeffrey Gipson
detailedReviews.text: Always great food!!

detailedReviews.author: Douglas
detailedReviews.text:
Let‚Äôs start with the service. When you go in there is always someone behind the counter who asks what they can do to help you. I‚Äôve been there several times and it has always been the same‚Ä¶polite & knowledgeable folks behind the counter. They have pizza by the slice under warming lights. As we all know that can be problematic depending on how long the pizza has been sitting there. It‚Äôs no different at Panhandler‚Äôs. At Panhandler‚Äôs you can rest assured that the pizza has not been sitting for hours because they refuse to serve you any pizza that has been under the lights for too long.
Whilst the folks there are marvelous, the star of the show is their pizza. I have traveled this entire country - every state but Hawaii. I have traveled into Canada mainland and surrounding islands. In the navy, I sailed up and down the east coast from Puerto Rico & Cuba down south to Nova Scotia and other places up North. I sailed all over the Mediterranean, stopping in Italy, France, Greece & Northern Africa just to name a few. More than a dozen countries. I have eaten pizza in every country and most ports we visited. I have eaten pizza for better than 60 years and I‚Äôm telling you, Panhandler‚Äôs Pizza is the best I‚Äôve ever eaten! Bar none. Why you ask? To begin with all the ingredients are prepared in-house‚Ä¶fresh cheese grated every morning. Fresh vegetables cut and prepared every morning. The dough they use? You guessed it! Prepared in-house along with the pizza sauce! That, my friends, makes all the difference in the world. But this would all be for naught if it wasn‚Äôt prepared correctly. The preparation - putting it together with an abundance of toppings and then cooking it to absolute perfection is the standard operating procedure, day in and day out. It has never varied from this norm every time I‚Äôve been there. If you love pizza like I do, you owe it to yourself to go to Panhandler‚Äôs Pizza and try their pizza. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

detailedReviews.author: Marcus Valdez
detailedReviews.text: This place has been amazing for life!   Love the pizza!  I‚Äôm older then dirt and this place has been a go to since high school.

detailedReviews.author: Kirk Payne
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza and salad.

detailedReviews.author: Kira Witte
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in FoCo!

detailedReviews.author: Amos Baldwin
detailedReviews.text: Always a great place for the family!

detailedReviews.author: Rene Fenton
detailedReviews.text: Went for class reunion.  Had a great time. Staff was friendly and constantly on the go, making sure  tables were cleared and we had everything we needed!

detailedReviews.author: Maureen Houser
detailedReviews.text: Panhandler's Pizza is by far the best pizza place in Northern Colorado... And has been since the 1970's! The best family restaurant in town!!!!

detailedReviews.author: scott krugman
detailedReviews.text: Been going here since high school.  Really glad it was purchased from previous ownership and they kept everything the same.

detailedReviews.author: Gr√úm√û≈†
detailedReviews.text: I ordered a single slice of pepperoni, the person in front of me ordered two and were given both corner slices. I got the middle slice which was half the size for the same price. Pizza was average and $5 for that tiny slice is insane. Very disappointed by my first time going here likely wont return which is sad because i live across the street.

detailedReviews.author: Beth Hackett
detailedReviews.text: We ordered for takeout and because we were in Fort Collins for an event, weren‚Äôt able to pick up our pizza until just before close. Our pizza was hot and ready plus the staff was friendly and efficient. Panhandler‚Äôs is the BEST!?

detailedReviews.author: Tyler Hernandez
detailedReviews.text: It‚Äôs so expensive now! $35 for a large pizza w/ 2 toppings?? Not worth it in my book.

detailedReviews.author: Jo Ann James
detailedReviews.text: Ordered online for pickup.  Order was wrong twice.  Too much sauce. Not enough flavor.  Not worth the money. I severely disappointed.  I could of ordered dominoes.

detailedReviews.author: Jeffrey ‚ÄúJeff‚Äù Means
detailedReviews.text: Pizza sauce is too sweet here for my tastes. Sigh the pizza auld be good but I just don't care for sweet pizza sauce.

detailedReviews.author: Anita Haviland
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza!  The sausage is made just for them.   Dough made fresh daily and cheese is grated not bought grated.   Waited on by Makaila who was pleasant and helpful.   Loved the manager Lani.  Music every Tuesday!

detailedReviews.author: Quentin Golden
detailedReviews.text: This was some of the best pizza I have had in my life.

detailedReviews.author: Charlotte Hood
detailedReviews.text: Completely enjoyable and reasonably priced.  BEST pizza I've had in a very long time.  200 plus miles from home, dang it.

detailedReviews.author: Chad Doerr
detailedReviews.text: 5 years later and I sure wish they‚Äôd have some slices ready to go. No I don‚Äôt want to wait 25 minutes. No I don‚Äôt want my wife to eat while I wait. It‚Äôs 5:30 on a Saturday you probably could have had some slices ready.

detailedReviews.author: Jim Perkins
detailedReviews.text: Great place, and a lot of fun. We go whenever I am in town.

detailedReviews.author: redneck ok
detailedReviews.text: Awesome spot great pizza great people

detailedReviews.author: WillBilly.the.HillBilly
detailedReviews.text: Amazing pizza but pricey

detailedReviews.author: Kirt Haynes
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza. Get there early they some times run out of slices.

detailedReviews.author: William ‚ÄúBrad‚Äù Blanchard
detailedReviews.text: Absolute best deep dish pizza! Service is sometimes slow but food makes up for it.

detailedReviews.author: Paul Nelson
detailedReviews.text: While food prices have gone up everywhere, at Pans a large deep-dish pizza feeds 4-6 people.  A better deal than Chipotle and tastes amazing!

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.3/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the friendly and courteous staff, enhancing the overall dining experience. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The unique and iconic sauce, unchanged for 40 years, is a standout feature that customers love. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
Panhandlers Pizza is renowned for its exceptional Chicago-style pizza, a rarity in Fort Collins and Colorado. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
improvementOpportunities: Long wait times and order inaccuracies - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Negative reviews and reputation issues - review management can address this concern
Poor online visibility and competition with nearby options - SEO services can solve this visibility issue

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
